events.name: Role of critical materials in global supply chains
events.wd_label: Role of critical materials in global supply chains
events.wd_description: The literature examines the impact of critical materials such as rare earths, cobalt, and lithium on global supply chains. Studies highlight market disruptions, bottlenecks, geopolitical risks, and co-production impacts on material demand.
events.description: The literature examines the impact of critical materials such as rare earths, cobalt, and lithium on global supply chains. Studies highlight market disruptions, bottlenecks, geopolitical risks, and co-production impacts on material demand.

events.name: Market disruptions
events.wd_description: Rare earths can disrupt markets and global supply chains from exploration to recycling.
events.description: Rare earths can disrupt markets and global supply chains from exploration to recycling.

events.name: Bottlenecks
events.wd_description: Bottlenecks may lead to shortages in cobalt and lithium, affecting supply chains.
events.description: Bottlenecks may lead to shortages in cobalt and lithium, affecting supply chains.

events.name: Geopolitical risks
events.wd_description: Geopolitical supply risks of metals, including dynamic perspectives on the global supply chain.
events.description: Geopolitical supply risks of metals, including dynamic perspectives on the global supply chain.

events.name: Co-production impacts
events.wd_description: Cobalt demand is impacted under different co-production and mining attractiveness assumptions.
events.description: Cobalt demand is impacted under different co-production and mining attractiveness assumptions.

events.name: Supply-side challenges and investments in the automotive industry
events.wd_label: Supply-side challenges and investments in the automotive industry
events.wd_description: The automotive industry faces significant supply-side challenges and substantial investment requirements. Volkswagen, for example, has committed over 33 billion Euros to developing electrified powertrains between 2019 and 2023.
events.description: The automotive industry faces significant supply-side challenges and substantial investment requirements. Volkswagen, for example, has committed over 33 billion Euros to developing electrified powertrains between 2019 and 2023.

events.name: Volkswagen investment
events.wd_description: Volkswagen has committed to spending over 33 billion Euros on developing electrified powertrains between 2019 and 2023.
events.description: Volkswagen has committed to spending over 33 billion Euros on developing electrified powertrains between 2019 and 2023.

events.name: Market conditions
events.wd_description: Declining global vehicle sales and current market conditions challenge the scale of capital outlay required.
events.description: Declining global vehicle sales and current market conditions challenge the scale of capital outlay required.

events.name: Technical challenges
events.wd_description: Technical challenges exist at different stages of the supply chain, including the complexity and cost of battery recycling.
events.description: Technical challenges exist at different stages of the supply chain, including the complexity and cost of battery recycling.

events.name: Battery recycling challenges
events.wd_description: The complexity and cost of battery recycling, particularly in compliance with high environmental standards, is a significant challenge.
events.description: The complexity and cost of battery recycling, particularly in compliance with high environmental standards, is a significant challenge.

events.name: Geographic mismatch and supply chain risks for critical materials
events.wd_label: Geographic mismatch and supply chain risks for critical materials
events.wd_description: The trends in demand for critical materials for EVs create supply chain risks due to the geographic mismatch between auto-chain production growth and resource production. China is projected to dominate global lithium and cobalt demand by 2030.
events.description: The trends in demand for critical materials for EVs create supply chain risks due to the geographic mismatch between auto-chain production growth and resource production. China is projected to dominate global lithium and cobalt demand by 2030.

events.name: Geographic mismatch
events.wd_description: There is a geographic mismatch between auto-chain production growth in Asia, Europe, and the US, and resource production dominated by Australia, the Americas, and Africa.
events.description: There is a geographic mismatch between auto-chain production growth in Asia, Europe, and the US, and resource production dominated by Australia, the Americas, and Africa.

events.name: China's dominance
events.wd_description: China's share of global lithium and cobalt demand for transport is projected to rise to about 68% by 2030.
events.description: China's share of global lithium and cobalt demand for transport is projected to rise to about 68% by 2030.

events.name: Supply chain risks
events.wd_description: The trends in demand for critical materials create supply chain risks due to geographic mismatches and dependency on specific regions.
events.description: The trends in demand for critical materials create supply chain risks due to geographic mismatches and dependency on specific regions.

events.name: Efforts to promote domestic battery manufacturing capacity
events.wd_label: Efforts to promote domestic battery manufacturing capacity
events.wd_description: Advanced countries are promoting the development of domestic battery manufacturing capacity due to rising supply chain risks. The EU and US governments are investing in battery-related projects to reduce import dependency.
events.description: Advanced countries are promoting the development of domestic battery manufacturing capacity due to rising supply chain risks. The EU and US governments are investing in battery-related projects to reduce import dependency.

events.name: EU efforts
events.wd_description: The EU has warned about the high dependency on battery cell imports and is increasing funding to battery-related projects.
events.description: The EU has warned about the high dependency on battery cell imports and is increasing funding to battery-related projects.

events.name: US efforts
events.wd_description: The US government has started to intervene, including funding domestic production of rare earth elements.
events.description: The US government has started to intervene, including funding domestic production of rare earth elements.

events.name: Regional investment
events.wd_description: Regional investment into the battery sector is beginning to flow, with significant funding announced for battery-related projects.
events.description: Regional investment into the battery sector is beginning to flow, with significant funding announced for battery-related projects.

events.name: Concentration of mineral processing capacity
events.wd_description: Mineral processing capacity is heavily concentrated in Asia, particularly in China. This concentration extends to lithium carbonate, cobalt refinery capacity, manganese, and nickel sulphate markets.
events.description: Mineral processing capacity is heavily concentrated in Asia, particularly in China. This concentration extends to lithium carbonate, cobalt refinery capacity, manganese, and nickel sulphate markets.

events.name: Lithium carbonate processing
events.wd_description: China accounts for 47% of lithium carbonate processing capacity.
events.description: China accounts for 47% of lithium carbonate processing capacity.

events.name: Cobalt refinery capacity
events.wd_description: China holds a significant portion of the global cobalt refinery capacity.
events.description: China holds a significant portion of the global cobalt refinery capacity.

events.name: Manganese and nickel sulphate processing
events.wd_description: China also dominates the processing capacity for manganese and nickel sulphate.
events.description: China also dominates the processing capacity for manganese and nickel sulphate.
